text.section: Each real estate broker shall maintain all records of trust money in a secured area within the office of the broker.

section.section:
Each licensee shall keep copies of:
listings; and
any other document executed or obtained by the licensee in connection with a transaction involving the provision of real estate brokerage services, including any electronic signature contained on a document.

A licensee shall keep the records required by this section for 5 years, starting on the date of the closing of a real estate transaction, or, if the transaction is not closed, 5 years after the date of the listing.
A licensee providing property management services shall keep the records required by this section for 5 years after the termination of the management agreement.

On reasonable notice from the Commission, a licensee shall allow a representative of the Commission to enter the licensee's place of business during business hours to inspect a record required to be kept under subsection (b) of this section.
The licensee shall provide, at the licensee's expense, a paper copy of any document or record requested by the Commission.
A licensee shall display to the Commission on demand all records, books, and accounts of any money held in trust.
